data: “There is a mountain called Seat-Sandal, between the Dunmail Raise and Grisedale Pass; and those who have stood upon its summit know that Grasmere vale and lake lie at their feet, and that Windermere, Esthwaite, and Coniston, with many arms of the sea, and a grand brotherhood of mountains, are all around them.”
Seat-Sandal | Dunmail Raise | Grisedale Pass | Grasmere | Windermere | Esthwaite | Coniston
Seat-Sandal | Dunmail Raise | Grisedale Pass | Grasmere vale | Grasmere lake | Windermere | Esthwaite | Coniston

"There is a mountain called Seat-Sandal, between the Dunmail Raise and Grisedale Pass; and those who have stood upon its summit know that Grasmere vale and lake lie at their feet, and that Windermere, Esthwaite, and Coniston, with many arms of the sea, and a grand brotherhood of mountains, are all around them."
The Squire of Sandal-Side: A Pastoral Romance
